newsitem.title: FINLAND: IVO, Foster Wheeler win Czech plant deal.
newsitem.headline: IVO, Foster Wheeler win Czech plant deal.

text.p: Finnish power producer and energy engineering firm Imatran Voima said on Friday it had won a power plant order from Czech Moravskoslezske Teplarna worth 300 million markka together with U.S. firm Foster Wheeler.

"IVO International will be the consortium leader, being responsible for the project management and design work for the plant," it said, but it did not say how the two partners would share the total value.
IVO International will also supply the plant's process and structural components, including a steam turbine, instrumentation and control, electrification, coal storage and the buildings, it said.

IVO said the plant would be modernised almost completely to generating 41 megawatts of electricity and a total of about 100 megawatts of district heat and process steam for the city of Olomouc and local industries.
The contract is a significant opening for IVO International in the Czech Republic, IVO said.
"Foster Wheeler will furnish the Olomouc plant with a boiler plant equipped with a latest generation circulating fluidised bed boiler, completely installed and commissioned," it said.
